gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: European Space Agency - Copernicus Services Coordinated Interface (SCI)

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Terms and conditions for the use and distribution of Sentinel data

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: The granule for the generation of this SLC product has been acquired as part of the Sentinel-1A mission. The satellite was launched part of the European Space Agency's Copernicus programme on April 3, 2014 and has a 12-day repeat cycle.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
The SENTINEL-1 mission is designed to provide enhanced revisit frequency, coverage, timeliness and reliability for operational services and applications requiring long time series.
The mission will provide an operational interferometry capability through stringent requirements placed on attitude accuracy, attitude and orbit knowledge, and data-take timing accuracy.
The constellation will cover the entire world’s land masses on a bi-weekly basis, sea-ice zones, Europe's coastal zones and shipping routes on a daily basis and open ocean continuously by wave imagettes.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString:
The user has the right to use, alter, modify, share, publish and distribute Sentinel data as well as Altered Products (e.g. histogram images, orthorecified image, re-sampled and rescaled image, mosaics and subsets of substantial size) and/or Derived Works (e.g. land cover classfications, vegetation indices, interferograms etc.) in accordance with the 'Terms and conditions for the use and distribution of Sentinel data'.
Neither ESA nor any other entity involved in the Copernicus Programme guarantees the accuracy and completeness of the Sentinel Data or its suitability for the purpose of the User’s activities. The User accepts the Sentinel Data “as is”. In particular ESA (or any other entity involved in the Copernicus Programme) shall not be held liable for any damage derived from the use of Sentinel data by the User or any third party except in case of wilful misconduct.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: data product generated in GeoTIFF format with ISO 19115 conformant metadata

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Geographic and temporal extent of the SENTINEL-1A product

gml:TimePeriod.gml:description: begin and end time of data acquisition of imagery

gmd:attributeDescription.gco:RecordType: single-look complex product in zero-Doppler slant range geometry

eos:description.gco:CharacterString: product timeliness of the processing (NRT-10m, NRT-1H, NRT-3h, Fast-24h, Off-line, Reprocessing)
interpretation of pixel value (Raw, Complex or Detected)

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: processing of SENTINEL-1A data to a SLC product

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: SLC Post Processing using Sentinel-1 IPF (version 003.61)

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: The Sentinel-1 mission is designed to provide enhanced revisit frequency, coverage, timeliness and reliability for operational services and applications requiring long time series. The Sentinel-1 SAR instrument and short revisit time will greatly advance users’ capabilities and provide data routinely and systematically for maritime and land monitoring, emergency response, climate change and security.

eos:description.gco:CharacterString: mission cycle the orbit is in
flight direction of the sensor (ASCENDING or DESCENDING)
time of the ascending node crossing
